meanings.definition: The act of dismissing or sending away.
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, the dismissions of the employees were swift and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The dismissions of the students at the end of the school day were orderly.
meanings.sent3: The dismissions of the puppies from the pet store were met with wagging tails.
meanings.sent4: The dismissions of the birds from their nests signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The dismissions of the guests from the party left the host feeling relieved.

meanings.definition: The state of being dismissed or sent away.
meanings.sent1: The dismissions of the workers led to a quiet office.
meanings.sent2: She felt lonely in the dismissions of her friends after they moved away.
meanings.sent3: The dismissions of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent4: In the dismissions of the storm, a rainbow appeared in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dismissions of the students from the classroom marked the end of the school day.
